mods.abstract: Ranaway FROM the plantation of Mrs. M.S. Prentice, near Tyler, on the 1st of August, a negro man named John, about five feet eight inches high ; about fifty years old ; head quite bald ; black complexion. Said negro was brought from Carroll Parish, La., and he may be trying to make his way back, he has been an old boat hand. A liberal reward will be paid for his deliveyr to met at Tyler, Smith co. Texas, or his lodgment in any Jail so I can get him again. Tyler, August 16th 1864. JOHN W. DOTEY, Agent for Mrs. M.S. Prentice *sept-3tf]
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
